result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany Hannah Strusz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County case 14CF160

records.addlTxt:
3:54 pm    TO INCLUDE 15CF18 
Defendant Brittany Hannah Strusz in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie: amended Informations filed on each case.  3 misd counts.  Def will plead guilty to 3 misd cts. recommending:  S/W Probation 2 years   Cond: rest TBD within 30 days    ($14,000 approximately)  2 victims wish to make statements.  Expungement possible if she successfully completes probation and makes all payments.  Loberg and his client agree.  Court reads the charges to the def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  14CF160 Def pleads guilty to Ct 1 misd theft.  Loberg stips to facts.  Def pleads guilty to Ct 2 misd theft.  Loberg stips to facts.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Cts 1 and 2 of 14CF160.   re:  15CF18  Def pleads guilty to Ct 1 misd theft.  Loberg stips to facts.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 of 15CF18.  Thorie makes sentencing argument.  Samantha Webb makes statement.  Carla makes statement.  Def makes statement.  Court addresses victims.  Restitution to be joint and several.  Court questions expungement.  Thorie responds.  Loberg responds.  
COURT ORDERS:
S/W  PROBATION 2 YEARS
CONDITIONS:  
RESTITUTION TBD WITHIN 30 DAYS (APPROX. $14,000)
COURT COSTS $243 ON EACH COUNT 
SUBJECT TO ANY CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE PROBATION AGENT.  
AGENT TO LOOK INTO HER CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY ISSUES - ASSMT AND FOLLOW THROUGH, AFTERCARE
AGENT TO LOOK INTO COGNITIVE BEHAVIORAL THERAPY 
RESTITUTION MUST BE PAID IN FULL TO RECEIVE EXPUNGEMENT 
Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Information is filed with the court. Copy is given to the defendant. Reading Waived.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to all counts  Court accepts the not guilty plea.  Set for plea hearing.

Atty Loberg files a waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Court reviews the waiver with the defendant.   COURT ACCEPTS WAIVER, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES THE PRELIMINARY HEARING.
